Title: Nigeria, UN sign pact on elections, political stability
Summary: Nigeria and the United Nations have signed a new Regional Partnership for Democracy (RPD) A framework aimed at improving elections, addressing political instability and strengthening democratic institutions across West Africa . Speaking yesterday at the signing ceremony in Abuja, the UN said the pact was signed by both countries .

Title: PBAN laments yearly importation of 4.8 million tonnes of wheat
Summary: Premium Breadmakers Association of Nigeria (PBAN) raises fresh concerns over the country’s dependence on wheat imports . Nigeria brings in more than 4.8 million metric tonnes of wheat every year to the country . PBAN laments yearly importation of 4.9 million metric tons of wheat .

Title: Tinubu hosts Duke of Edinburgh, explains economic reforms
Summary: Tinubu says reforms will secure future for Nigerian youths . Reforms will empower them with skills that will make them globally competitive . The President, who received the Duke of Edinburgh, explains economic reforms .

Title: Wike-military land feud: Dauda insists on rule of law
Summary: Joseph Daudu (SAN), insists on rule of law . Wike-military land feud: Dauda insists that the Minister of Federal Capital Territory, Nyesom Wike, should not be involved in it .

Title: Insecurity: FG trains NCoS spokespersons on strategic
Summary: The Federal Government has called on Public Relations Officers (PROs) across all commands of the Nigerian Correctional Service, (NCoS), to deepen their engagement with the media as a way of ensuring professionalism to boost public trust in the Service .

Title: Makarfi resigns as PDP BoT secretary
Summary: His resignation followed the emergence of Kabiru Turaki — a former minister of special duties and intergovernmental affairs — as the PDP’s new national chairman .

Title: Households yet to feel relief despite sharp drop in inflation — CPPE
Summary: National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) reported that headline inflation eased to 16.05 percent in October . Households yet to feel relief despite sharp drop in inflation — CPPE .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 18, 2025
Summary: The naira traded broadly steady on Tuesday as liquidity in the formal Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) kept the official exchange rate steady .

Title: Africa must rethink its strategy for fair global trade — FG
Summary: Nigeria has called on African nations to rethink their collective approach to global trade, warning that no country on the continent can thrive in isolation amid shifting economic pressures . Speaking at the 2nd African Cassava Conference in Abuja on Monday with the theme, “Building Sustainable & Quality Driven Cassava Industries in […]

Title: CBN rate hike boosts fix income market —AIHN
Summary: The Association of Issuing Houses of Nigeria said aggressive interest rate hikes boosted investors’ demand for fixed income instruments in 2024 . President of the association, Kemi Awodein, spoke during the AIHN’s Annual General Meeting and presentation of 2024 financial statements in Lagos .
